intro: Lepisorus medioximus, commonly known as the broad-leafed rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments. The fronds are typically broad and leathery, with a distinct midrib and serrated margins. This plant is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in shaded forest floors, where it forms dense colonies. Its botanical features make it well adapted to humid, temperate climates.
